intro: Rhytachne rottboellioides var. guineensis, commonly known as the African hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats.
